title: Mgmt 123: Managerial economics
text:
Class schedule: Tuesday & Friday | 14:30 - 16:00  Instructor: Christopher Llones  e-mail: christopher.llones@vsu.edu.ph  Pre-requisites: Econ 11  Course credits: 3 units  Number of hours: 3 hrs lectures per week 


Course description
This course discusses the integration of economic theory and business functional areas for managerial decision-making.


Course objectives

Understand the basic concepts in managerial economics.
Explain price determination in competitive markets.
Understand the theory and empirical analysis of demand.
Explain theory and empirical analysis of supply.
Apply economic theories in different market structure.



Course outline









Week
Topics

Description




Week 2
Module 1: Introduction to managerial economics

Economic theory and business economics
Managers, firms, and markets.
Fundamentals of managerial decision-making.


Discuss what managerial economics is and its relationships to other discipline.



Week 3-6
Module 2: Price determination in competitive markets

Demand, supply, and market equilibrium
Elasticity and total revenue


Explain the laws of demand and supply.
Identify factors that cause demand and supply to shift.
Describe consumer surplus and producer surplus
Explain market equilibrium.
Define price elasticity of demand and use it to predict changes in quantity demanded and changes in the price of a good.
List and explain several factors that affect price elasticity of demand.
Explain the role price elasticity plays in determining how a changes in price affects total revenue.



Week 7-8
Module 3: Theory and empirical analysis of demand

Theory of consumer behavior.
Empirical demand functions.
Demand forecasting.


Understand the role of budget set and indifference curve in determining the choice that gives consumer maximum satisfaction.
Understand the various concepts of demand estimation and demand forecasting.
Discuss the various methods that can be used for estimation and forecasting of demand of product.



Week 10-13
Module 4: Theory and empirical analysis of supply

Production and costs in the short-run.
Production and cost in the long-run.


Explain the general concepts of production and costs analysis.
Examine the structure of short-run production based on the relation among total, average, and marginal products.
Calculate long-run total, average, and marginal costs from the firmâ€™s expansion path.



Week 14-17
Module 5: Market structures

Market structures under perfect competition.
Other market structures (e.g., oligopoly, monopolistic competition, and monopoly.


Discuss three characteristics of perfectly competitive markets.
Explain different forms of market structure and their underlying assumptions.
